image

Class FileAccess

  • java.lang.Object
    • image.FileAccess

  • public class FileAccess
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will be the class that opens a picture, stores that in memory and returns that. for now only a stub, more documentation will come soon
    Author:
    Ylva

      static void writeAfterHistogram(java.awt.image.BufferedImage buffer)
      Will write an image in the folder ./OutputImages/AfterHistogram/ The image will be named "plate01.png" for the first plate the 01 is the platenumber, can be 01 till any number as long as there are input images of that plate number
      static void writeBlobDetection(java.awt.image.BufferedImage buffer) 
      static void writeFirstColorFilter(java.awt.image.BufferedImage buffer)
      Will write an image in the folder ./OutputImages/FirstColorFilter/ The image will be named "plate01.png" for the first plate the 01 is the platenumber, can be 01 till any number as long as there are input images of that plate number
      static void writeImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage buffer)
      Writes an imageFile in the OutputImages folder called plate01.png where 01 is the platenumber
      static void writeNumberPlateLocation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage buffer)
      Will write an image in the folder ./OutputImages/NumberPlateLocation/ The image will be named "plate01.png" for the first plate the 01 is the platenumber, can be 01 till any number as long as there are input images of that plate number

      • writeAfterHistogram

        public static void writeAfterHistogram(java.awt.image.BufferedImage buffer)
        Will write an image in the folder ./OutputImages/AfterHistogram/ The image will be named "plate01.png" for the first plate the 01 is the platenumber, can be 01 till any number as long as there are input images of that plate number
        Parameters:
        buffer - the image to write

      • writeFirstColorFilter

        Parameters:
